title: Bahn: Bahnstrecke zwischen Hannover und Minden gesperrt
content:

Die Zusammenfassung für diesen Artikel kann leider momentan nicht angezeigt werden.
ZEIT ONLINE hat diese Meldung redaktionell nicht bearbeitet. Sie wurde automatisch von der Deutschen Presse-Agentur (dpa) übernommen.
Wegen eines Blitzeinschlags ist die wichtige Bahnstrecke zwischen Hannover und Minden in der Nacht zum Sonntag über Stunden gesperrt gewesen. Am Morgen sagte ein Bahnsprecher der Deutschen Presse-Agentur, der Abschnitt sei wieder freigegeben worden.

Die Sperrung dauerte etwa vier Stunden. In dieser Zeit wurden Züge den Angaben zufolge über Bremen umgeleitet. Das Unternehmen hatte auf seiner Internetseite von massiven Beeinträchtigungen wegen des Unwetters im niedersächsischen Lindhorst gesprochen.

Dem Bahnsprecher zufolge gab es bundesweit keine weiteren Störungen wegen der Gewitter, die in der Nacht zum Sonntag über weite Teile Deutschlands gezogen waren.

translation: Thank you for using ZEIT ONLINE. Register now with your existing account or test our digital subscription with access to all articles. Appearance Unfortunately, the summary for this article cannot be displayed at the moment. ZEIT ONLINE has not edited this message. It was automatically taken over by the Deutsche Presse-Agentur (dpa). Due to a lightning strike, the important railway line between Hanover and Minden was closed for hours during the night. In the morning, a German Presse-Agentur said that the section had been released again. The blocking took about four hours. During this time trains were diverted according to the information about Bremen. The company had talked on its website of massive impairments due to the storm in Lindhorst, Lower Saxony. According to the railway spokesman, there were no further disturbances nationwide due to the thunderstorms that had been drawn over large parts of Germany during the night on Sunday. © dpa-infocom, dpa:240630-99-582405/3 Due to a lightning strike, the important railway line between Hanover and Minden was closed on Sunday.In the morning, a railway spokesman from the Deutsche Presse-Agentur said that the section had been reopened. The closure lasted about four hours. During this time trains were diverted according to the information about Bremen. The company had talked on its website about massive impairments due to the severe weather in Lindhorst, Lower Saxony. According to the railway spokesman, there were no further disturbances nationwide due to the thunderstorms that had taken place over large parts of Germany during the night on Sunday.
